summary: The Department of Defense—like other federal agencies—encourages minority-owned and women-owned businesses to apply for contracts to supply products and services. We looked into DOD's spending on products and services supplied by these types of businesses, and found that it spent $32 billion in FY 2016. Although that is 12% less than in FY 2010, overall spending by DOD decreased 27% during the same period. About...
title: Minority- and Women-Owned Business Contracting: Analysis of DOD Contract Awards, Fiscal Years 2010-2016
